title: Sarah's Homemade Applesauce Recipe
description: This applesauce recipe is easy to make from scratch with apples, sugar, and cinnamon for a delicious topping on pancakes, ice cream, or pork chops.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Applesauce Recipes Sarah's Homemade Applesauce 4.8 (3,388) 2,546 Reviews 314 Photos This applesauce recipe is simple to make and delicious! I make it for my younger brother all the time and he loves it — and he hates canned applesauce! Submitted by PHATCAT Updated on September 23, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 314 314 314 314 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Making applesauce at home is easier than you think. Trust us: This wildly popular applesauce recipe will quickly become a go-to in your household.  How to Make Applesauce You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics of making perfect homemade applesauce: Applesauce Ingredients Make this top-rated applesauce recipe with just four ingredients:  Apples: Four apples will make about four servings of applesauce. Water: You’ll need about ¾ cups of water to cook the apples. Sugar: White sugar sweetens things up. Cinnamon: Ground cinnamon lends welcome warmth.  Best Apples for Applesauce The best apples for applesauce are whatever apples you have on hand and need to use up. However, if you have a choice, we recommend using a combination of sweet and tangy varieties for the best flavor. Popular sweet varieties include Honeycrisp and Fuji, while popular tangy varieties include Granny Smith and Braeburn.  How to Make Homemade Applesauce Combine the ingredients in a saucepan and cook over medium heat until the apples are soft, then mash the (cooled) apples with a fork until you’ve reached the desired consistency. That’s it! Find the full, step-by-step applesauce recipe with detailed instructions below.  Related: What's the Difference Between Applesauce and Apple Butter? What to Serve With Applesauce For a classic and impressive dinner, pair your applesauce with our Easy Baked Pork Chops. It also works well alone as a delicious and healthy breakfast or snack.  How to Store Applesauce Allow the applesauce to cool, then transfer to an airtight container. Store in the refrigerator for up to three days.  How to Can Applesauce To preserve your homemade applesauce for up to a year, consider canning it at home. Check out our Canning How-To Guide for detailed instructions.  Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “Wow, was this good,” raves Lindsay. “I followed the recipe. I used Granny Smith apples which worked really well. Served slightly warm and was really amazing! Hadn’t made homemade applesauce before, but I definitely will again!” “This recipe was easy to follow,” says one Allrecipes community member. “I scaled it up to use six big apples, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon, and a half cup of sugar. It was delicious! I've made it twice now. I use a stick blender to achieve proper consistency.” “Simple is often the best,” according to Phaedra Conaway. “I used McIntosh apples, but didn't peel them. It gave the applesauce more texture, color, and nutrition.” Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 apples - peeled, cored and chopped ¾ cup water ¼ cup white sugar ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine apples, water, sugar, and cinnamon in a saucepan; cover and cook over medium heat until apples are soft, about 15 to 20 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Allow apple mixture to cool, then mash with a fork or potato masher until it is the consistency you like. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 5,136 home cooks made it! If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Sarah's Homemade Applesauce 01 of 314 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 314 Photo by  TxCin2 10/29/2024 I have never made my own applesauce before and it was much easier than I expected. The hardest thing was smashing those cooked apples with a fork, so I'd use an immersion blender the next time. I used 4 Honeycrisp apples. The flavor on this was fresh apples and cinnamon. It wasn't as sweet as store bought, and it wasn't pureed which I liked. I like the texture of the fruit and I didn't mind a few larger bits in this. This was very fresh and I love knowing what's in my applesauce and there are no preservatives, no additives, and no chemicals in this. I might back off on the water a little next time, or else take the lid off so it evaporates some as I'd have liked it a little less watery. It had a great flavor, and now when I need applesauce, I'll know exactly how to make it. 03 of 314 Photo by  sunburywhite 10/14/2024 Easy to follow Recipe is great. Ingredients proportions perfect. I used 1 each 4 apples; 2 tart, 2 sweet. I substituted coconut sugar for white sugar, added a tablespoons of salted butter and added 1/2 tspn allspice, coriander powder, nutmeg, powdered ginger. I like a lot more spice obviously. Finally I left the skins on so after cooling the chunky apple concoction, I put it in a blender to smooth it out to break down the skins. It was amazing with pork chops, collard greens and roast red potatoes. Leftover sauce wonderful on top of buckwheat pancakes. 04 of 314 Photo by  BrightClam4577 09/15/2024 A keeper! Worth the effort Easy to follow 1 kg apples, peeled and cored, 1 cup water (use less next time), 2 tbsp sugar, cinnamonCooked in crockpot, low pressure 20 min. 05 of 314 Photo by  Grocery Addict 09/08/2024 OK with tweaks Delicious! My only complaint is that it didn’t make very much—only about 1.5 cups worth. I used Fuji apples that were a little too mealy to eat out of hand (they were obviously from last season since I purchased in the summer), but this was the perfect way to make them worthwhile. Added about ½ teaspoon of kosher salt and a squeeze of fresh lemon juice to wake up the flavors. Will definitely make again! 06 of 314 Photo by  vicki936 07/18/2024 Really good! I bought a bag of apples on sale and needed to use them up so I made some applesauce and froze it. I like to use applesauce instead of oil in my baking. I used half white and half brown sugar, slightly less than the recipe called for. Much better than store bought and worked out great in my banana bread. 07 of 314 Photo by  JennyD 11/26/2023 It's sooo yummy. I made it 2xs. Fiest time I did as per recipe. I found it to be a little too much water.The 2nd time I doubled it up. Even though there was too much water in the first round, I wanted to make sure with a double batch. So I'm just straining the rest of the water. My husband loves it! 08 of 314 Photo by  SavvyBeet1567 10/28/2023 It was very good. Thank you for this recipe 09 of 314 Photo by  QuirkyChive9245 10/28/2023 Simple recipe, few ingredients and quick. I had six apples that needed to be used so I had to adjust the other ingredients. I threw a dash of cayenne just because. After mashing with fork, I put it in blender with several pulse rotations to blend those last small chunks. 10 of 314 Photo by  QuaintSoda2099 10/26/2023 I have been wanting to make homemade apple sauce for a long while now. Haven’t had homemade since I was a child. So I looked up a recipe and this one seemed easy and simple. I went on to make it following the recipe to a tee. And mashed it just a bit leaving some chunks. I let it thicken a bit while it cooled down and then I tasted it. One taste hmmm this is good one more taste wow this is absolutely delicious I could eat it all in one sitting. I will be keeping this recipe and make it multiple times a month. I highly recommend this! Perfectly sweet and perfectly cinnamon flavored. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Applesauce 288 Ratings Slow Cooker Applesauce 423 Ratings Blushing Applesauce 28 Ratings Fresh Applesauce 150 Ratings Doug's Easy Applesauce 41 Ratings Apple-Pear Sauce 2 Ratings Chunky Cinnamon-Orange Applesauce 9 Ratings Slow Cooker Cider Applesauce (No Sugar Added) 76 Ratings No Cook Applesauce 13 Ratings Willis Farm Applesauce 13 Ratings Applesauce for the Freezer 49 Ratings Slow-Cooker Apple Raspberry Sauce 1 Rating Rice Cooker Recipe: Raspberry Applesauce Carrot and Pear Sauce 3 Ratings Creamy Apple Cinnamon Raisin Oatmeal 75 Ratings Rosy Strawberry Rhubarb Applesauce 6 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. instructions: Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Combine apples, water, sugar, and cinnamon in a saucepan; cover and cook over medium heat until apples are soft, about 15 to 20 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Allow apple mixture to cool, then mash with a fork or potato masher until it is the consistency you like. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
